Name: Wooden Comb for Weaving Linen
Description: Linen was the main fabric available at the time and the finest linen was combed. The essential tool for this process, the combs, are composed of five rectangular vertical pieces of wood with a handle in the middle piece. These pieces are attached with a wire from the middle and end with tiny teeth. Workers would hold the comb between two blocks of stone or rest it on a piece of stone and hold it with their feet. Then they would slam the bundle of linen fibers down and comb it to extract the finest of the fibers.
